Method Detail

loginPlayer

public Key loginPlayer(com.sun.gi.utils.UUID appID,
                       java.lang.String playerName,
                       java.lang.String password,
                       byte[] playerInfo,
                       ChannelManagerListener listener)
This method is invoked in order to log a player into the channel system.

Parameters:
playerName - A player name for display purposes. (May or may not be required to be unique according to the underlying server's login requirements.)
password - A login password. Depending on the system this may be per player (in which case name must be unique) or it may be a system-wide password.
playerInfo - A block of data to be associated with the player. (The format and details are system dependant.)
Returns:
This returns a player Key used to identify the player for permissions purposes for the duration of this session.

createChannel

public Key createChannel(java.lang.String channelName,
                         byte[] channelInfo,
                         boolean reliable,
                         boolean inOrder,
                         boolean owned)
This method is invoked in order to create a packet channel. The channel may or may not make any gaurantees about delivery depending on how the channel type flags (reliable, inOrder) are set.

Parameters:
channelName - A non-unique name for the channel.
channelInfo - A packet of data to be associated with the channel. (The format and content is game specific.)
Returns:
A channel key used to identify the channel owner for administrative purposes.

addPlayerToChannel

public void addPlayerToChannel(long channelID,
                               long playerID,
                               Key key,
                               ChannelListener listener)
This method adds a player to a channel. To be successful the caller must pass in the channel key returned from createChannel(...).

Parameters:
playerID - The ID of the player to add.

dropPlayerFromChannel

public void dropPlayerFromChannel(long playerID,
                                  long channelID,
                                  Key channelKey)
This method is used to remove a player from a channel. To be successful the caller must pass in the channel key returned from createChannel(...).

Parameters:
playerID - The ID of the player to remove from the channel.
channelKey - The key to the channel the player is to be removed from.

destroyChannel

public void destroyChannel(Key channelKey)
This method is used to eliminate a channel. All players still joined to the channel will be removed and then the channel will be eliminated.

Parameters:
channelKey - The key to the channel to be eliminated.

logoutPlayer

public void logoutPlayer(Key playerKey)
This method logs a player out of the system. Events will be generated showing the player elaving any channels theya re still joiend to and then the player will be disonnected from the system.

Parameters:
playerKey - The key to the player to be logged out.

sendPacket

public void sendPacket(long channelID,
                       long mask,
                       Packet packet)
                throws java.io.IOException
This method places a packet into the channel. Delivery gaurantees are as set for the denoted channel at channel creation time.

Parameters:
channelID - The channel to place the packet into.
mask - A mask that can be used be recievers to filter pacekts.
java.io.IOException

readPacket

public boolean readPacket(long channelID,
                          long playerID,
                          long mask,
                          boolean exactMatch,
                          Packet packet)
                   throws java.io.IOException
This method will attempt to read a data packet into the passed in packet object. If exactMatch is true then it will return the next packet whose mask is equal to the passed in mask (mask1 == mask2). If exactMatch is false then it will return the next packet which has a 1 bit in common with the mask (mask1 & mask2 != 0). Reading with this call marks the packet as read by the passed in packet. It will be skipped in subsequent reads with the same packet object but but will still be available to be read by other packet objects. If there is no match, this call returns null.

Parameters:
channelID - The ID of the channel to read from.
mask - A mask to strain the packets
exactMatch - If true, mask matching is doen by equality. If false then the mask match test is a bitwise AND.
Returns:
TRUE if data was read.
Throws:
java.io.IOException - If a packet is used whose type flags do not match the flags set on creation of the channel, a PacketMismatchException is thrown. If an IO error occurrs the appropriate IOException will be thrown.

takePacket

public boolean takePacket(long channelID,
                          long playerID,
                          long mask,
                          boolean exactMatch,
                          Packet packet)
                   throws java.io.IOException
This method will attempt to read a data packet into the passed in packet object. If exactMatch is true then it will return the next packet whose mask is equal to the passed in mask (mask1 == mask2). If exactMatch is false then it will return the next packet which has a 1 bit in common with the mask (mask1 & mask2 != 0). Reading with this call removes the packet from the channel such that it cannot be read by other players. Other players will skip this packet and proceeed to the next one that can be returned to satisy a read or take. If there is no match, this call returns null.

Parameters:
channelID - The ID of the channel to read from.
mask - A mask to strain the packets
exactMatch - If true, mask matching is doen by equality. If false then the mask match test is a bitwise AND.
Returns:
TRUE if data was read.
Throws:
java.io.IOException - If a packet is used whose type flags do not match the flags set on creation of the channel, a PacketMismatchException is thrown. If an IO error occurrs the appropriate IOException will be thrown.

waitForPackets

public boolean waitForPackets(long playerID,
                              long[] channelIDs,
                              long[] masks,
                              boolean[] exactMatches)

createPacket

public Packet createPacket(long channelID,
                           int length)
This method allocates a Packet object with all of the packet type fields set appropriately for the spcified channel. It will allocate a fixed-length packet with a maximum data-space the size indictaed in the length parameter.

Parameters:
channelID - The channel this packet will be sent or read on.
length - A fixed maximum data size for the packet.
Returns:
The newly allocated Packet object.

createPacket

public Packet createPacket(long channelID,
                           int length,
                           boolean growable)
This method allocates a Packet object with all of the packet type fields set appropriately for the spcified channel. The packet's data-space will begin with the size specified in the length parameter. If the groewable parameter is true then that size will grow as needed to accomodate data read/written with it. (Likely producing garbage in the process.) createPacket(...,...,false) is functionally equivalent to createPacket(...,...)

Parameters:
channelID - The channel this packet will be sent or read on.
length - A fixed maximum data size for the packet.
growable - If true then the data space will be grown as necessary to fulfill read/write requests.
Returns:
The newly allocated Packet object.
